news_header: On Thursday, President Trump ordered the development of reciprocal tariffs on imports to the US, adhering to his 'eye for an eye' trade policy. He stated that the US will charge the same tariffs that other countries impose on American goods.
news_original_title: What are reciprocal tariffs? Trump's trade agenda explained
news_text: This follows previous tariff announcements, including a 10% tariff on Chinese imports. Economists warn that these tariffs could raise consumer prices and lead to inflation, while also potentially igniting a global trade war. The White House has given officials 180 days to identify countries with higher tariffs than the US, with the aim of targeting those first. The announcement has sparked negotiations with various countries, including India and the EU, which have expressed concerns about the implications of these tariffs.
